title: Bank of America to Cut Overdraft Fees to $10 From $35
sub_head: Regulators, politicians have been pressuring banks over fees; JPMorgan, Ally Financial have already announced changes
body:
Bank of America Corp. said Tuesday it would cut overdraft fees to $10 from $35 beginning in May, following other big banks that have rolled back or ditched such charges.
Overdraft fees, which are charged when customers donâ€™t have enough cash in their accounts to cover their purchases, are under scrutiny by regulators and politicians who say they unfairly exploit cash-strapped families. Under the Biden administration, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency have pressed banks to scale them back. In a December report, the CFPB flagged Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Wells Fargo & Co. for their overdraft fees.
